channel.title: Data Transmitted To and From Runescape/Computer?
channel.description:
I am wondering if theres a possibilty, to moniter the Data that runescape transmits to the Computer and what the computer transmits back.
And Change The values, By using a proxy connection to modify the data.
I know that this has been done before by someone who would probably like to remain nameless. But I wish to continue after him.
The source code to this Program has since been sold and has died,
You may know it as RuneBot, which was the latest version of the program,
He also Found the Item Creation method known as Duping.
I know that runescape now Encrypts all the data sent back and forth, But there must be some logical way to either Decrypt it or send non encrypted values back?
would the system still recognise it? Or Would it Alarm jagex?
I know most of you don`t have a clue what im saying, or you may?
but let me know what you think or if its even slightly possible.
Im a C++ programmer by trade, And i have decent knowledge of Java.
Have fun Replying

Renax:

wrong junsito would deposit the mils in the bank chest at his POH, then withdraw it from a bank, and the mils he put into his chest stayed there but they also went to his bank. I have this confirmed through his RL friend.

item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

and create a botting application.

And if you made a packet-sending bot application, it’s possible you might uncover some new bugs, :\

But before one could could even begin to speculate (speculation is all that seems to be going on in this thread for the most part :P) one would first have to create a packet sending bot, which is not an easy or quick endeavor.

item.description:
@system wrote:

Kryptizzler:

Even if you got past encryption, they would know something isn’t if there’s not mouse movements at all.

you can send mouse movements to the server using the proposed method.

if you did de-encrpyt the data(in theory) you wouldn’t be able to dupe but you could send packets and create a botting application.

item.title: Data Transmitted To and From Runescape/Computer?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

You mean a packet editor? Wont work. When you send a packet to an RS server saying to pick up 1,000,000 GP, the server will first verify that those coins really exist in the coordinates you are trying to pick them up from. And you can’t spam the server with 1,000,000 “pick up one gp” packets, because again, it will try to verify it. Same with items. Same with skills. Pretty much everything you do in RS runs through the server first, so it wont be possible to trick it, unless you have direct access to the server. And as Regex said, the trading thing wont work either. The best you will be able to do is auto.

Read full topic
item.source: Data Transmitted To and From Runescape/Computer?
